docs.lead_paragraph: Gay people who are lucky enough to work for employers that extend health benefits to their same-sex partners are still at a disadvantage: they must pay an extra tax on the value of those benefits that heterosexual married couples do not pay.

headline.main: Barclays to Reimburse Gay Workers for Health Benefit Tax

docs.abstract: Barclays will reimburse its employees in the United States with same-sex partners for a tax they pay when using domestic partner health benefits.
docs.snippet: Barclays will reimburse its employees in the United States with same-sex partners for a tax they pay when using domestic partner health benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Tim Pawlenty of Minnesota is stepping up his attack on President Obama's federal health care law with a court filing challenging its cost to states. Mr. Pawlenty and Gov. Donald L. Carcieri of Rhode Island, both Republicans leaving office soon, joined Thursday in the filing. It seeks permission to submit a friend-of-the-court brief in support of a lawsuit being pursued by 20 states. Mr. Pawlenty has been vocal in his opposition to the law. He says he will make repealing it a focal point of a run for president in 2012 if he wages a campaign.

headline.main: Minnesota: Pawlenty Sharpens Attack On Health Law

docs.abstract: Minnesota Gov Tim Pawlenty steps up attack on new federal health care law with court filing challenging its cost to states; Rhode Island Gov Donald L Carcieri joins in filing (S)
docs.snippet: Gov. Tim Pawlenty of Minnesota is stepping up his attack on President  Obama's federal health care law with a court filing challenging its cost to states. Mr. Pawlenty and  Gov. Donald L. Carcieri of Rhode Island, both Republicans leaving office...

docs.lead_paragraph: Young designers are now the focus of a New York City initiative to provide mentors and new retail concepts. Others are trying to save the garment district, where many factories have closed or laid off workers and raised prices. Fabric costs are up, especially for cotton, and just about everyone who deals with manufacturing in China knows you can't get a minimum of anything: 1,000 blouses maybe, but not 100. Department stores threaten to cancel orders if a delivery is late. Meanwhile fast-fashion companies reap the rewards of being nimble and democratic while grabbing the ideas of others. Prestige labels hold on to their heritage. And consumers wonder: Where's your app?
docs.abstract: Jesse Finkelstein and Katie King are not immune to the problems of young business owners - they are entrepreneurs as much as they are designers - but they have found a way around at least some of them. Three years ago they opened a design and manufacturing studio in India, which produces the clothes they design under the label JF & Son
